rename.from: brokrn styles on hover in activity
rename.to: broken styles on hover in activity

body: It's related to the tippy style change @silverwind
Yes, this is related to the removal of the default 1rem padding. Will check.

Problem is, this lib does not expose any way to allow modifying these tippy instances:

https://github.com/razorness/vue3-calendar-heatmap/blob/955626176cb5dc3d3ead8120475c2e5e753cc392/src/components/CalendarHeatmap.vue#L200-L204

And even if I raise a PR, it seems likely it's not going to be merged anytime soon.
So I think the proper solution is to pass `tooltip=false` to the lib and instantiate our own tippy.

> So I think the proper solution is to pass `tooltip=false` to the lib and instantiate our own tippy.

That's what I said in https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/30732#issuecomment-2085395594 : `I still do not think it is safe to backport.`

Now we have limited time to fix this new regression.
It's fine, it's a minor cosmetical issue.

issue.title: Fix tippy styling on heatmap

labels.name: lgtm/need 2
labels.description: This PR needs two approvals by maintainers to be considered for merging.

issue.body: Fixes: https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/30808 I will follup up with an [upstream](https://github.com/razorness/vue3-calendar-heatmap) PR to enable us to pass options to these tippy instances.
